title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 606.36 - Noninterference with reservoir operations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6 ยง 606.36 - Noninterference with reservoir operations

State Regulations

The granting and issuance of any permit, or any renewal
thereof, shall in no wise prejudice or interfere with the rights of the board
or the district to release water from, or impound or store water in, the
reservoir, or to do any other act or acts in the operation, maintenance and
regulation of said reservoir; all risks and hazards in respect thereto, as well
as any resultant damage therefrom, shall be assumed by the permittee or any
person or persons exercising the privileges of the permit, without any recourse
to or right of action against the State of New York, the district or said
board. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 6
ยง
606.36

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
